1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

2.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a dirge (as accompanied by beating the breasts or on instruments)

3.brief: to say (used with great latitude)
Tsor, a place in Palestine
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a haven

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to travel for trading
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
to say (used with great latitude)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
{YHWH}
Tsor, a place in Palestine
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

I
complete; as noun, the whole (specifically, a sacrifice entirely consumed); as adverb, fully
beauty

properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed

Shenir or Senir, a summit of Lebanon
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
probably meaning to glisten; a tablet (as polished), of stone, wood or metal
a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)

to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a pole (as a mast or flagstaff)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt

Lud, the name of two nations
